jewel.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a valuable stone, such as a diamond
jewel.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a very small stone used in the machinery of a watch
jewel.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: something or someone that is very valuable, attractive, or important
jewel.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: He introduced her to Budapest, a jewel of a city.
jewel.translation[0].note_box[0].section: a valuable stone, such as a diamond
He had a large fortune in gold and jewels.
the crown jewels (=the crown and other valuable objects worn by the king or queen on important royal occasions)
a rare and valuable jewel such as a diamond or an emerald
The handle of the sword was decorated with precious stones.
a jewel that has been cut into a special shape
The cross had large red gems set into it.
Her eyes were shining like gemstones.
a valuable stone, but one that is not as rare or valuable as a diamond, ruby, emerald etc
Lapis lazuli is a semi-precious stone that was often used by the ancient Egyptians.
a single jewel, especially a large diamond
a gold ring with a diamond solitaire
